page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: Gazetteer Hemsworth appeared as{Hamelseworde}in the original Domesday Book. It changed from a largely agricultural settlement to a mining community when Hemsworth and South Kirkby pits were sunk in the late nineteenth century. At this time there was a large influx of skilled and unskilled labour and rapid housing development occurred as a result; Most of this is still much in evidence as brick built terrace houses, there are also developments of Council houses and estates of private houses reflecting the range of society now resident in Hemsworth. The surrounding land is predominantly agricultural with a small village at South Heindly.
